reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are really small, the bed takes up nearly the entire space, but at least there are windows which are double glazed to keep out the noise. The pictures on their website make it look a lot bigger and nicer than it really is. Cleanliness wise it was fine.
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because it was cheap-ish and not too far from the airport. There's a few bars and restaurants in the vicinity, but it is a good 20 minute walk from the nearest train station. The corridors reeked of cigarette smoke and the staff were not particularly friendly or helpful. If you only need an overnight transit stop it's fine, but if staying for longer I'd look elsewhere.
reviews.title: A Last Resort ...

reviews.text: It was a couple months back that we stayed at this hotel ... have just returned from traveling :)
reviews.title: Budget price, highly recommend

reviews.text: Singapore is famous for its small expensive hotels ... but I am surprised how pristine clean and groomed Singapore has so many dirt and well-worn hotels!! Le Peranakan Hotel was no exception to this ... but what made it worse was that we had to be in Singapore on the one weekend that they were hosting the Formula 1 races ... so all the hotels jacked up the prices and Le Peranakan Hotel doubled in price (we had to pay $140SIN / Night) which made it hurt more.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy, great value for money

reviews.text: It is in a safe area, you can get a bus/subway into town ... taxi is easier ... if you just need a place to crash on a quick layover ... then fine, but bring a sleep sheet! Room are your typical Singapore small with a cramped bathroom complete with glass door. Personally, I think that the China Town area is better and via taxi to/from the airport is no more difficult to get to.
reviews.title: Not the best but worth the price..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a terrible stay. Aircon constantly breaking down. No-One answering at reception. Ladies of the night everywhere. This is not a family hotel. You have been warned. Rooms far too small. We had bare electrical cables where wall lights once were. Covered with a sliver of masking tape.
reviews.title: Dont stay there !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Hotel Le Peranakan because of cheap price, but when we saw our room, it was really really small. Its impossible that 2 person can walk in the room at the same time. My wife must wait on bed, until im finish. There´s only one bed and the aircondition is directly above the bed. The cold wind comes directly on you during night.
reviews.title: REALLY REALLY SMALL ROOM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roomservice didnt clean our room one night.
reviews.title: Boutique style, average experience

reviews.text: You should spent litte more money and choose another hotel. Its absolutly not comfortable to stay in this hotel. Only if you´re alone, maybee it works.
reviews.title: Just for a few hours....

reviews.text: Its a chinese hotel and all rooms are same size.
reviews.title: Good little hotel

reviews.text: the positives....price....thats about all really. singapore is v.expensive.
reviews.title: second stay here...not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel location isnt great. mrt is too far to walk. taxi is cheap however into cbd.
reviews.title: Small, smelly and incompetent staff!!!

reviews.text: matress was really comfy but i found 4 hairs in the bed. i had a long flight and was too tired to change rooms. yuck! the carpet was also dirty not too mention the state of the bedroom walls, with masking tape covering holes in the wall....says it all really!.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet good location no tv no window

reviews.text: in the morning the cleaners woke me up chatting outside the room at 8am mad worse by the fact the corridors are narrow and the rooms are all bunched together. i coudnt get back to sleep as there was a massive skylight beaming daylight directly onto my head! (rm22)
reviews.title: Tiny and Basic

reviews.text: last stay was average/ok. i definately woudnt stay again. pay a bit more and go and stay in an ibis or mercure hotel and sleep happy. or i'd recommend the transit airport hotel, as its very very cheap, and lots of things to do in changi airport (public cinema, pool etc)
reviews.title: Small but quality hotel. Clean, Safe and Free Wifi, yippee!

reviews.text: My mom and I were put in a standard room with a double bed. The room was quite small and did not have any chairs to sit on which was quite frustrating. Also, the air conditioning wasnt very powerful hence my sleep wasnt as comfortable as it should have been. The room does have a slight musky smell, probably due to poor ventilation. The television is attached to the wall, but it can only be watched from the head of the bed because of the angle it was positioned. The channels were pretty limited.
reviews.title: Not bad room, but location was a bit of an issue

reviews.text: The good stuff were that it is clean, they change your towels everyday (not sure about the sheets), and they provided us with 2 bottles of complimentary water each day. There is free wifi, but i was unable to access it from my room, only when i was in the lobby. The lobby is unimpressive as it is so small and there is no where to sit. It can literally only accommodate 4 or 5 people. Not very practical. There are quite a few good food places around the hotel though, the best one being the Beach Rd Prawn Mee (apparently a popular one with the locals). Other good things include the bus stop being walking distance to the hotel, with buses going straight to orchard rd. But the closest MRT is Eunos, which is still 20 minutes away, and not really walking distance, hence pretty inconvenient.
reviews.title: Small Rooms but Great Quality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend Le Peranakan to people who are confident with traveling and exploring singapore with ample time, but not for those who want to be close to the city centre (Le Peranakan is approx. a 35 - 40 minute (peak time) or 25 - 30 minute (off-peak) bus ride from Orchard Rd)
reviews.title: Small but conventient

reviews.text: The Single Room was rather tight, but I really didn't mind because everything else was perfect. Definitely an A with cleanliness and hygiene. Toilet, carpet and sheets were almost pristine in condition.
reviews.title: Small room but very good quality.

reviews.text: Plenty of food and pubs downstairs and along the street. The famous Beach Road Prawn Mee down the road is a must-try. Moving around is pretty easy too as there are direct buses to Orchard Road and City Hall, amongst other hotspots.
reviews.title: Average but good
